verses.verse: Then answered <S%H6030><s%> Eliphaz <S%H464><s%> the Temanite <S%H8489><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>,
If one assay <S%H5254><s%> to commune <S%H1697><s%> with thee <S%H3811><s%>, wilt thou be grieved? But who can <S%H3201><s%> withhold <S%H6113><s%> himself from speaking <S%H4405><s%>?
Behold <S%H3256><s%>, thou hast instructed many <S%H7227><s%>, And thou hast strengthened <S%H2388><s%> the weak <S%H7504><s%> hands <S%H3027><s%>.
Thy words <S%H4405><s%> have upholden <S%H6965><s%> him that was falling <S%H3782><s%>, And thou hast made firm <S%H553><s%> the feeble <S%H3766><s%> knees <S%H1290><s%>.
But now it is come <S%H935><s%> unto thee <S%H3811><s%>, and thou faintest; It toucheth <S%H5060><s%> thee <S%H926><s%>, and thou art troubled.
Is not thy fear <S%H3374><s%> of God thy confidence <S%H3690><s%>, And the integrity <S%H8537><s%> of thy ways <S%H1870><s%> thy hope <S%H8615><s%>?
Remember <S%H2142><s%>, I pray thee <S%H6><s%>, who ever perished, being innocent <S%H5355><s%>? Or where <S%H375><s%> were the upright <S%H3477><s%> cut off <S%H3582><s%>?
According as I have seen <S%H7200><s%>, they that plow <S%H2790><s%> iniquity <S%H205><s%>, And sow <S%H2232><s%> trouble <S%H5999><s%>, reap the same <S%H7114><s%>.
By the breath <S%H5397><s%> of God <S%H433><s%> they perish <S%H6><s%>, And by the blast <S%H7307><s%> of his anger <S%H639><s%> are they consumed <S%H3615><s%>.

The roaring <S%H7581><s%> of the lion <S%H738><s%>, and the voice <S%H6963><s%> of the fierce lion <S%H7826><s%>, And the teeth <S%H8127><s%> of the young lions <S%H3715><s%>, are broken <S%H5421><s%>.
The old lion <S%H3918><s%> perisheth <S%H6><s%> for lack <S%H1097><s%> of prey <S%H2964><s%>, And the whelps <S%H1121><s%> of the lioness <S%H3833><s%> are scattered abroad <S%H6504><s%>.
Now a thing <S%H1697><s%> was secretly brought <S%H1589><s%> to me <S%H241><s%>, And mine ear received <S%H3947><s%> a whisper thereof <S%H8102><s%>.
In thoughts <S%H5587><s%> from the visions <S%H2384><s%> of the night <S%H3915><s%>, When deep sleep <S%H8639><s%> falleth <S%H5307><s%> on men <S%H582><s%>,
Fear <S%H6343><s%> came <S%H7122><s%> upon me <S%H7461><s%>, and trembling, Which made all <S%H7230><s%> my bones <S%H6106><s%> to shake <S%H6342><s%>.
Then a spirit <S%H7307><s%> passed <S%H2498><s%> before my face <S%H6440><s%>; The hair <S%H8185><s%> of my flesh <S%H1320><s%> stood up <S%H5568><s%>.

It stood still <S%H5975><s%>, but I could not discern <S%H5234><s%> the appearance <S%H4758><s%> thereof <S%H4758><s%>; A form was before mine eyes <S%H5869><s%>: There was silence <S%H1827><s%>, and I heard <S%H8085><s%> a voice <S%H6963><s%>, saying,
Shall mortal man <S%H582><s%> be more just <S%H6663><s%> than God <S%H433><s%>? Shall a man <S%H1397><s%> be more pure <S%H2891><s%> than his Maker <S%H6213><s%>?
Behold <S%H539><s%>, he putteth no trust in his servants <S%H5650><s%>; And his angels <S%H4397><s%> he chargeth <S%H7760><s%> with folly <S%H8417><s%>:

How much more <S%H637><s%> them that dwell <S%H7931><s%> in houses <S%H1004><s%> of clay <S%H2563><s%>, Whose foundation <S%H3247><s%> is in the dust <S%H6083><s%>, Who are crushed <S%H1792><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the moth <S%H6211><s%>!
Betwixt morning <S%H1242><s%> and evening <S%H6153><s%> they are destroyed <S%H3807><s%>: They perish <S%H6><s%> for ever <S%H5331><s%> without any regarding it <S%H7760><s%>.
Is not their tent-cord <S%H3499><s%> plucked <S%H5265><s%> up within them <S%H4191><s%>? They die, and that without wisdom <S%H2451><s%>.
